thread.title: SC asks Army to continue service of gallantry award-winning woman officer
thread.title_full: SC asks Army to continue service of gallantry award-winning woman officer - The Times of India

author: Dhananjay Mahapatra
title: SC asks Army to continue service of gallantry award-winning woman officer
text:
NEW DELHI: The Supreme Court on Thursday asked Army to continue the service of Lt Col Mithali Madhumita, the first woman officer to win gallantry award while she was posted in Afghanistan.
Lt Col Madhumita had sought permanent commission but the Army had denied her permanent commission on the ground that she had opted against it earlier and made the request for permanent commission just prior to her short service commission coming to an end.
However, a bench headed by Justice T S Thakur told the Army that it need not at present set up a board for considering granting permanent commission to her. SC said it will decide her petition and till then let her continue as a short service commission officer.
Madhumita while posted in Afghanistan in 2010 had braved the odds during a terrorist strike to rescue many of her injured colleagues and send them to hospital.
Army through its counsel told the court that if she was allowed to wriggle out of her earlier decision not to opt for permanent commission, which was acted upon by the authorities, then it would encourage others to make similar requests just before their short service commission engagement coming to an end creating difficulties for the Army.
